title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Part of the application process is completing a recorded, automated phone interview. You are asked questions via a recording on the phone, and your answers are recorded then reviewed. An in person interview was scheduled after.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a phone screen that was very brief and asked for previous experience, qualifications, and if I was willing to work weekend and holidays. Then was invited for another interview in person a week later.
Interview Questions: What previous experience do you have?

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Interview went great. I was excited about my interview but it went great and I was very comfortable and confident during and after the interview. Would definitely recommend looking forward to being employed by this company :)
Interview Questions: Why did I want to take on this job.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: quick and easy. hr was nice. appreciated feedback and excited to start position. got to interview with person I was working under - nice to meet that person before starting the position
Interview Questions: what of your experience makes you a good fit?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Great environment and work ethics, very professional, welcoming staff. Makes you feel like you are truly a part of the team. I have all the support I need to practice.
Interview Questions: How to deal with stressful situations.

title: Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: After applying I received and email to schedule a phone interview. First I did a telephone interview with a recruiter and then after being notified the next day I scheduled a virtual interview with the hiring manager. It was a about a 2 month process to do both interviews and then 2 weeks after the 2nd interview receive notification I would not move on in the hiring process.
Interview Questions: How will you mange remote employees?

title: Med Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick 20-minute phone call. We reviewed my resume and a few short questions were asked. At the end of the call I was told that my resume would be forwarded to the hiring manager and if they were interested they would send me an email.
Interview Questions: Are you available to work every third weekend?

title: Account Liaison Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Tucson area Initial phone call screening, lasted about 10mins. 2nd interview in person with the BD manager. 3rd interview with ED only. 4th "informal" interview was with a current Account Liaison. Over 2 weeks without company follow-up I received a denial. I was a bit taken back by the informal request to meet with a current hospital liaison to see if I was a good fit. During the session I was informed that there were 2 past ALs that departed from the company rather quickly so they wanted another staff to provide insight on new hires. I found that to be quite unprofessional and questioned the decision-making capacity of current management. The lack of "follow through" from the company was stark contrast from them preaching about that sentiment during the interview process.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you describe your marketing approach.

title: Collections Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: the interview was via phone call but it was an automated system and I never received a call back or additional feedback, which was frustrating and in my opinion it felt unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What is in your background?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: They were very professional. They asked great questions and were very communicative throughout the entire process. I was extended and offer and accepted. I would recommend this company and their HR dept.
Interview Questions: Standard and thoughtful interview questions.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Very personable interviewer, lots of transparency and knowledgeable about the unit. I liked that it was a two step interview and I was able to ask some questions during my phone interview and then get more clarification during my in person interview
Interview Questions: What kind of schedule I was looking for

title: STNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Sylvania, OH) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was very kind and welcoming. They asked several questions and asked if I had any I wanted to ask them. I got a tour of the facility and was introduced to other staff.
Interview Questions: Do you have any concerns regarding the position?

title: Application Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview given if your salary expectations are correct for what they want + key words on resume; lots of STAR questions, video chat with manager, asked one "fun" question at the end - how do you keep up with technology.
Interview Questions: Describe job history, give STAR examples of what you did in tough situation, how are you troubleshooting if code breaks, how do you keep up with technology

title: Accounts Payable Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Zoom Call was done for a prescreening interview.  They asked basic interview questions including  what salary I was requesting, best qualities, worst qualities, etc.  It was an easy process to go through.
Interview Questions: What were my best qualities

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: I saw that this facility in Easton was hiring so I took it upon myself and I applied and was called in a week for an interview. The interview was straightforward and they were friendly and nice.
Interview Questions: What would you say are your strengths?

title: Marketing Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: First, I applied for the job online and received a follow-up email. We then set up a time for a phone interview that lasted about 30 minutes. After that process, we then set up an in-person interview that also lasted about 30 minutes. The people were nice and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Accounting Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very nice and friendly.I talked with dicret manager. My interview was both behavioral questions and technical questions. My technical questions were in three parts From Math, Accounting, and Excel.
Interview Questions: What is your level on Excel?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Interview with HR first that asked character related questions. Then interviewed with the hiring managers in a relaxed setting just getting to know each other. They made me feel comfortable and it was easy to talk to them about my background and the job
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a negative interaction with a coworker

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at ProMedica in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email to set up an interview. It was easy to schedule. The questions in the interview were standardized screening questions, but they did not allow for discussion of my most relevant and prior work experience.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my most recent job experience, even though it was not the most relevant experience for the position.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ProMedica (Monroe, MI) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Was told what was required; ask if I could perform the requirements; I replied yes. I ask about the culture. If it was a teamwork oriented environment. I was told yes. Typical interview.
Interview Questions: Have you hung cardiac drips? Yes

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Received call a few days after application. Scheduled interview for end of that week. Met with manager of business and director of personal development. Total time about hours. Received follow up call a day later with tentative offer pending HR procedures.
Interview Questions: They asked for me to explain my experience with Hospice.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: It is Difficult to get through to hiring manager. It is Not the most organized and Recruiters know very little about the jobs. It’s difficult to know really what job your applying for before you get to the interview point.
Interview Questions: More about my experience than anything

title: Medical Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done over the phone with Human Resources company that Promedica uses for the hiring process. It was a pretty basic interview. Had my resume available. Most info I needed was on my resume.
Interview Questions: Do I enjoy my current work assignment?

title: Unit Clerk/Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter was very nice and understanding considering the restrictions of covid and face-to-face interaction. They asked very basic "tell us about yourself" type of questions (i.e., current employment, how do you fit in this position/why work here, etc.).
Interview Questions:
Where do you currently work/what do you currently do?
Why do you want to work here?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consist of a phone screening with the recuriter, an interview and then a peer interview with individuals apart of the rehab team. Then had to provide 5 professional references.
Interview Questions: What made your interested in this job position.

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by their recruiter by email. We then spoke on the phone. There were no remaining positions that I was interested in after this; when I informed the recruiter of this and thanked them for their time/said I was no longer interested, they went above and beyond to find me opportunities fitting my desired path (emergency). I wound up interviewing with two ER unit managers from different hospitals within ProMedica. Both interviews were phone calls. I was offered both positions later that day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a difficult patient and how you handled the situation.

title: Tax Senior Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy process - one interview over the phone and one in person. Spoke with boss, boss's boss, and a coworker to ask questions. Tour of building. Got an offer later that day.
Interview Questions: Experience, past salary - no 'tricky' questions

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: For the interview, I met with a group of supervisors who were very friendly and seemed to have a good relationship (a sign of a good workplace). They also seemed to take their job very seriously, and they asked me very in-depth and serious questions about my values.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a patient was asking you to take them to their new room before the nurse signs off on their departure?

title: Registration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Did not seem much like an interview, I came in and they asked me about my self and then explained how their building worked. Was easy to talk to just did not seem professional
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourseld

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Called by a recruiter.  Interview was short but hiring process very long.  Took weeks before getting an offer.  After talking to a recruiter I was eventually contacted by the department manager for an in person interview then a peer interview
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Oregon, OH) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: They really take the time to get to know you, see why you want to work for them, and make sure you are comfortable. It’s a comfortable environment and the conversation flows easily!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for our Hospital system

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The process was seamless and the phone interviewer Miranda was such a delight! The in person interview was equally as comforting and smooth though there were 3 people there with me. The on boarding process post interview was also incredibly smooth and straight forward.
Interview Questions: I see you have “.....” experience, could you elaborate on that? And how that could help in this position?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied for numerous positions just about 3 weeks ago. Received an email to schedule a phone interview to discuss each position in more depth. Was surprised to get questions on compensation being it was just a phone interview but they did ask. I have an in person interview scheduled here soon.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions: After application online, I was sent an email to complete a phone screen with recruiting. After the phone screen, I was then scheduled for a face to face interview with manager.
Interview Questions: What is your definition of customer service?

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview set up, but the recruiter never called as scheduled and they did not contact me to reschedule. They had not given me their contact information, so I was unable to get a hold of them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Good, submitted resume and was scheduled for interview promptly. Interview was simple and based off of previous experience in this field. Nice one on one chat and shared personal experiences. Nice process easy to interview.
Interview Questions: About my experience and time on the job

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: The nurse manager was polite and asked typical hospital questions. She wanted to know medical background training. The manager asked what future plans I had. She wanted to know if I was pursuing  a nursing careers. Question of work hours was asked because of the varying hours of the hospital.
Interview Questions: What do like about working with patients?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, interview and peer interview . Very easy . Simple questions like order of draw to what would you do in a situation. You have to go through multiple interviews and be patient for a call after each interview
Interview Questions: What’s the most common place to draw from

title: Medical Technologist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews, first one was with human resources, then the second was with area supervisors. then the 3rd interview was peer review interview. In between each interview I had things to do like drug test and a survey.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you encounter a problem?

title: Diagnostic Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: You have to take a typing test and a basic grammar, spelling, and math test prior to interview. The interview occurs at a different location then the typing test. Panel style.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview was an over the phone pre-screen, which went well. I received a follow-up call a day later and was scheduled for a 2nd interview with two other managers. The second interview seemed very rushed and the only question pertaining to my skills that were asked was what I knew about Taleo. I do not feel I was given a real chance to express what I had to offer because the interviewers were in a hurry.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Diagnostic Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Okay - Quiz they give you is bogus, and does not relate to the job. Typing test is cake. Their paper test is what holds them back from growing their department.
Interview Questions: Does your current employer know your interviewing for this role?

title: Pre-Analytic Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straight forward with typical questions. I had a short phone interview, followed by an in-person interview with the processing manager and then a peer interview with some of the other processors.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to work with people you didn't agree with on a project. How did it work out?

title: Social Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at ProMedica in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Simple process overall. Included the facility DOR and Social Worker. In total, it lasted about 20 minutes.  Both friendly and personable. Not corporate feeling at all. Asked what I knew about insurances, community resources and how I felt with difficult or upset patients/families.
Interview Questions: How would you help families understand insurance is not covering their stay any longer?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at ProMedica (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview scheduled to go over my resume and ask why you want to work for the company. It was a very short conversation.  That's about it  the lady was slightly late too calling me
Interview Questions: can you pass a drug and nicotine test

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Interview they asked questions I answered came back for a second interview a week later.  They make an offer then HR takes over as the middle man for negotiations.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled with the supervisor first but she was ill so I did the peer review first. I was notified the day of the interview about 30mins before I was suppose to be there. She asked if I wanted to reschedule then pushed to just do the peer review and "get it out of the way".
Interview Questions: You see an employee entering weight and height without taking measurements. What do you do?

title: Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Quick unprofessional not work related waste of time would not recommend person interviewing was unprofessional messy office unorganized was not aware that I had already taken all the test so did not even have the test results
Interview Questions: What can you bring

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at ProMedica in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Contracted as a traveler. Telephone interview obtained through my recruiter. The process was very quick. I was warmly greeted on the telephone, given very clear direction of expectations, and my schedule was accommodated as I requested. Most easy interview I have every encountered!
Interview Questions: Experience, types of surgeries

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very flexible in scheduling an interview time.  Discussed experiences, why I was applying for the job/what interested me about the job, and my future goals. Two managers were present and then I came back on a separate day to meet with the team. It was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Experiences, why I was applying/what interested me about the position, goals for the future

title: Nutrition Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Sylvania, OH) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: apply online on the ProMedica website. Then the recruitment office will contact you for a phone interview. After the phone interview, they will ask if you want an open position and d then you will schedule an interview in person at the hospital.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Was called in to interview with the pharmacy director. When I got there, I interviewed w/ her first, then I interviewed with the entire team without her in the room. They went around the table, and each got to ask me a question.
Interview Questions:
How do I work within a team? 
How do I handle difficult coworkers?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica (Sylvania, OH) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very relaxed and positive. There was an interview with a manager and then a peer interview with 2 other nurses.  It was lengthy and very thorough.
Interview Questions: What experience do you bring to our organization

title: Speech Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at ProMedica (Oregon, OH) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Several thorough and professional questions. An overall positive experience. It was a peer interview with a colleague I would be working closely with, he was enjoyable too. A nice way to meet your fellow coworkers ahead of time. It was an overall positive experience.
Interview Questions: What is your area of interest and why?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through Promedixa, a receptionist called to schedule an interview within the month. I went to the interview and spoke one on one with a hiring manager. It was very laid back, she did most of the talking. I really just had to hold the conversation. She offered me the job onsite and I started about a month later.
Interview Questions:
tell me about yourself 
why do you want to work here

title: Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and straightforward process. Questions were the typical interview questions. Interviewer made me feel comfortable which is hard during a interview. Smooth interview but make sure you do your research.
Interview Questions: Info about the company

title: Senior Patient Account Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with Department Supervisor and Team Lead. Asked general interview questions regarding my past employment history. Work ethic and the ability to work with various types of personalities. Asked to act out a general customer service call from a patient.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time when you resolved a patient complaint with a positive outcome

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Sylvania, OH) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: met with manager of new unit, had 2 units. Friendly, but didnt know much about policies or patients on new unit. Downplayed amount of floating and mandated time off. The interview itself was short, maybe 30 minutes at most. Had the idea that I probably had the job if I wanted it.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work there?

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ProMedica (Monroe, MI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Took about 20 minutes and was interviewed by 2 people at the same time. 
The interview questions were already put together in a packet and they just asked about situations in previous employment. Once i told her about my upcoming 2-days-a-week college school schedule she instantly didn't seem interested in me anymore, even though it was a part-time job. Whatever, I ended up finding a better job with better pay anyways.
Interview Questions: Name a time in your last job when you had to deal with an angry customer.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: I was sent over there by a Staffing agency and was unprepared for the interview. Every question was followed up by "Give me an example". It was more of an interrogation, then an interview. He did not take the time to make me comfortable. One of the questions was "What was said about you on your last yearly evaluation", followed by "Why did the say that?". I was also asked what my "Values" were which I felt were personal as he was basically asking if I was what? Catholic?
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to terminate an employee.

title: Room Service Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Fostoria, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Cookie cutter interview questions were rushed through without actually hearing any answers. I could have probably told them I was a cannibal and would have gotten the same smile and nod with an "Okay, great!"
I was told that the interview process would take almost two hours, so I prepared accordingly.  Instead it was ten minutes with a dismissive interviewer with a weak handshake who wouldn't make eye contact.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult thing about your last job and how did you handle it?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Every one interviews differently in company, but promedica asks employees to do more of a behavioral based interview process.  My interview was with a very professional seasoned veteran with the company. Good experience!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself... Open ended questions.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of 3 parts: An advanced skills test, a Microsoft Excel test, and an interview with the hiring manager. After the tests and interview, I asked when I would hear of the next steps in the interview process. I was told by the hiring manager sometime in the next week. After not hearing anything for 2 weeks, I emailed the hiring manager to see if they had any update. Since that email, I have heard nothing. Poor follow-up with potential employees with non-existent communication.
Interview Questions: Recall a time where something did not go your way, how did you respond?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Recruitment is an awesome there. The recruiter made me feel very comfortable. I met her at a college job fair, she told me where to apply and soon I was offered an interview in the department.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to the company?

title: Payroll Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Had an entry level interview with recruiter. Went over my resume and talked about my compensation requirements. About a month later I was called for an interview with hiring manager. Very basic interview questions about my experience. A week after that I had an interview with 6 peers. The peers asked a lot of questions. Main purpose was to see how I fit in with the group.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? Why would you be a good candidate for position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with excellent questions. About my nursing experience.  Team work questions.  How handle certain situations.  Where do you view yourself in five years?  Why do you want to work here?
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Nursing Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared to share specific personal examples of leadership, teamwork, and communication skills. Also, you will be asked to give a mock "shift report" to a panel of directors. Insight into why you wanted to be a Nurse in the first place is just as important as showcasing your academic achievements. They seemed to be very interested in the heart, soul, and personality of the candidate more than simply brains. Be thoughtful and true.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to make a decision you knew others would not agree with. How did you handle it and what was the outcome?

title: Systems Engineer Position In Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Received an email from a promedica recruiter asking for me to apply for the position. I did so, and in a couple of days received another email, this time from the hiring manager. She wanted to set up a date for an interview, which was quick and painless. I arrived at the interview 5 minutes early and the front desk person seemed like he was expecting me, then he asked that I wait. While I sat in the stuffy and very hot waiting area (think cheap doctors office), I could clearly hear the front desk guy looking for the people I was interviewing with, then after a short while he asked me to come with him. At some point as I followed, the guy realized that nobody was ready, or even around, so he asked me to go back to the waiting area again. Then I noticed there was a guy with a lot of gel in his hair sitting at the end of the hallway hollering as he closed his laptop to "bring him back!", yet I was clearly standing right there. That was a little odd I thought. I went to the conference room and ended up interviewing with 4 individuals; one team member, the gelled hair holler-er who ended up being some kind of "hot shot" supervisor who was way overdressed, and no doubt thought highly of himself, and two managers. They asked standard IT questions but seemed like they wanted to show off how awesome they thought their infrastructure was. Telling me little knowledge nuggets like "we have over 400 technicians" and "we're using blah blah blah", standard gloating type comments about how great they are. The hot shot supervisor aka gel guy had a bunch of meaningless specs on thousands of accounts and other uninteresting facts which seemed to impress his managers as he recited them (having no doubt just looked them up moments before we first met). It was humorous enough. The overall interview went well and I left with an overall positive feeling. Alas, I was never to hear from them again. That is the reason for my review here. I thought it to be pretty bizarre and border line unprofessional to leave no follow up with their potential candidates. No letter, no phone call, no email. Nothing... Nada... Zip! The thing that is irritating to me is that I was "feeling them out" just as much as they were trying to discover their "perfect match". I took time to devote to a potential career move with Promedica, and mind you I'm employed, so to me time really is money. I can safely say that I am no longer interested in Promedica. I will close with my overall thoughts: the office looked dated and booring, cubicles were jammed everywhere, almost no window light whatsoever, and super uncomfortable and stuffy. The employees that I saw as I walked by seemed to be silently screaming to me "run away!", "run as fast as you can before you get sucked in!!!", "it's a trap!!". Hopefully you get the point. Promedica seemed like it would be a wonderful opportunity. Unfortunately it seemed like a really bleak and unpleasant looking work environment. I felt bad for the "team member" who looked like he was forced to be there. Not only did he have no questions for me, but the managers forced him to ask me something. Pretty weird. My advice is to skip this one. As IT professionals we have opportunity to work in amazing fields and places that care about you. Save yourself for something better!
Interview Questions: Ohio State or Michigan

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Sylvania, OH) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: They call or email you depending on preference, Then a initial interview is set to which you should dress formally no dirty holey jeans with a wife beater and no miniskirts or tight clothing. you will be taken on a tour of the facility and introduced to some members of the staff and then return to the department office talk to the supervisor or manager and that concludes the interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have previous cleaning experience? would you be willing to learn new more effective ways of cleaning?

title: Sales Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I had been applying online and in person for months with no response. Happened to meet a Director at a concert who gave me her card. I emailed her my resume and had an interview the next week and an offer soon after that.
Interview Questions: none I recall

title: Rehab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica (Dayton, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: :) great company. Friendly staff. Fair interviewing process. Just wasn't what I was looking for career wise. Too far of a drive especially in the winter time. Was looking for part time due to my college class schedule.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself career wise in 5 years?

title: Respiratory Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Traditional
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you had a problem at work.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Took a couple of weeks. Two interviews total. HR interview was comfortable with standard behavioral based questions.
Interview Questions: Cannot remember. A lot of situational type questions.

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at ProMedica in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied on by going to their career section. I got a phone call a week later for an interview with the hiring manager. Interview was very much to the point. A lot of behavioral questions. Afterwords, the hiring manager took me around and introduced me to her team. That was a very nice experience.
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected questions. A lot of work related and "tell me about a time" questions.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: Was unprofessional at Bay Park.
Interview Questions: Didn't ask much about my professional experience

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Maumee, OH) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Had 2 interviews and took a basic skills test.
First interview was with 4 people that were all from IT at different levels.  They just asked me about my career experience, handling conflicts with coworkers, etc. 

Was pretty typical, not really a technical interview at all.  The skills test was pretty easy, if you can't get through it you probably don't have any business being in IT.  It was that easy.
Interview Questions: If you were on your way to help a user with a problem and someone else stopped you in the hallway to ask you about helping with their issue what would you do?

title: Director of Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two in total, first interview with a VP and CHRO and the second interview with the hospital President.  Very professional and practical.  I have a lot of experience interviewing so yes the situation was stressful however I prepare and it went very well.  The best thing to remember is be yourself, research the organization, prepare and the interview will go well.
Interview Questions: What don't you like about HR?

title: Medical Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by administrative assistant, who scheduled a phone interview for me and asked that I send in writing samples beforehand. About two weeks later, the phone interview was completed, in which typical questions are asked - what I wanted out of the job, what they expected and really determining whether we were a good fit for each other. I was then informed that they'd like to schedule an in-person interview with me, as I was from from out of town. The interview was an all day process, from 7am to 3:30 pm, and they were kind enough to treat me to lunch. I did have to travel back and forth between locations a few times, with little travel time. Many of my interviewers were late to our meetings, which made keeping on schedule a real challenge. Exhausting process, but very few uncommon occurrences for this type of job.
Interview Questions: I was asked very few technical or relevant questions. However, I was asked to sit down with one stakeholder who wanted to write a case report. After giving me an overview of the case, they asked to me outline how I would write it for publication. On the spot, that was a little tricky.

title: Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call the next week for come in for an interview.  This interview took place with a member of HR.  The following week I received a call from an assistant of an administrator asking me to come in and interview with the administrator the following week.  I interviewed with the administrator, and I received an offer the following Friday.  Overall the process took three weeks.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time you went above and beyond.

title: Pharmacy Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ProMedica (Maumee, OH) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview with dept manager, second interview with peers in the department and members of outside departments. All participants asked questions, no script. Asked questions pertaining to family and availability. The first interview lasted approximately 45 minutes and the second interview lasted over an hour. There was approximately 2 months between interviews.
Interview Questions: If you were able to work until all queues were cleaned out on Fridays regardless of time.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met initially with the director of the unit and then met with a panel of employees from the unit. The panel included day nurses, night nurses, the educator, and the phsyical therapist. Many of them asked questions of me which was somewhat overwhelming. Not all units use the panel interview.
Interview Questions: how do you work with nurses who may have a different background then you?

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: two people interviewed me--what would be my direct report and his direct report. They asked technical questions and job history. Pretty much what you would expect with no surprises. two people interviewed me--what would be my direct report and his direct report. They asked technical questions and job history. Pretty much what you would expect with no surprises.
Interview Questions: Technical and job history

title: Security Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at ProMedica (Toledo, OH) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is amazing. Each applicant gets points based on their answers in a peer panel interview. Hiring is based on how well each applicant scores. What makes the scoring unique is the fact that it can later be used for promotion as a last resort. If tow individuals with the same seniority are up for promotions, the interview score is used as the last tie breaker.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a suicidal patient yielding a weapon?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fairly easy and uncomplicated. There were questions about my schooling and experience.  I received a facility tour after interview was over.  Interviewer was going to be my direct boss. She made me feel very comfortable with everything. Other employees made me feel welcome during process.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Purchasing Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ProMedica (Adrian, MI) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: You have to fill out application, can be done online, interview with HR.  References, background check, physical testing...no smokers are hired as of 1/1/13.  You will discuss the job details and description of the job.  Most interviewing is now set up through centralized HR which is based out of Maumee, Ohio.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at ProMedica (Adrian, MI) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: was easy when I applied. they were desperate.
Interview Questions: what is your nationality
